Latest News: Thailand introduces new entry regulations as China reopens border (Reuters, 09.01.2023)

International Restrictions:
*All travellers: You do not need to present COVID-19 related document such as certificate of vaccination and COVID-19 test results upon arrival in or transit through Thailand.
As of 9 January, if you are visiting Thailand and then travelling to a country that requires a RT-PCR test for entry, you will need to purchase medical insurance prior to your arrival in Thailand that provides cover for Covid-19 treatment.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Thailand: Domestic travel options within Thailand are available but remain subject to disease control measures.
COVID-related restrictions in Thailand: From 1 October 2022, Thailand reclassifies COVID-19 from a dangerous communicable disease to a communicable disease under surveillance.
Mask wearing is a voluntary practice. However, the Ministry of Public Health continues to recommend that you wear a mask in a crowded or badly ventilated area such as public transportation, hospitals, elderly care homes, and kindergarten. Inside public buildings, you will need to wear a mask unless you are by yourself or are doing activities in which a mask cannot be worn. More information can be found on the PR Thai Government page. *Accommodation: Hotel and private rental accommodation is available throughout Thailand. However, some hotels, services, and facilities may remain closed.
Hotels may take your temperature on arrival and ask you to provide information on your recent travel history and any symptoms you may have related to COVID-19. You may also need to follow other disease control measures implemented by the hotel. We advise you to contact hotels directly when booking.
